definitions.text: a path over which electrical signals can pass
examples: a channel is typically what you rent from a telephone company

definitions.text: a passage for water (or other fluids) to flow through
examples: the fields were crossed with irrigation channels
gutters carried off the rainwater into a series of channels under the street

definitions.text: a long narrow furrow cut either by a natural process (such as erosion) or by a tool (as e.g. a groove in a phonograph record)
a deep and relatively narrow body of water (as in a river or a harbor or a strait linking two larger bodies) that allows the best passage for vessels
examples: the ship went aground in the channel

definitions.text: (often plural) a means of communication or access
examples: it must go through official channels
lines of communication were set up between the two firms

definitions.text: a bodily passage or tube lined with epithelial cells and conveying a secretion or other substance
examples: poison is released through a channel in the snake's fangs

definitions.text: a television station and its programs
examples: they offer more than one hundred channels

definitions.text: a way of selling a company's product either directly or via distributors
examples: possible distribution channels are wholesalers or small retailers or retail chains or direct mailers or your own stores

definitions.text: transmit or serve as the medium for transmission

examples: channel information towards a broad audience

definitions.text: send from one person or place to another
